narrative.narrative: Jeju Air is a South Korean airline that is based at Jeju City on the island of Jeju, and has hubs at Seoul-Incheon and Seoul-Gimpo in addition to Jeju. Jeju is the hub for its domestic operations. It was founded in 2005 and began operations on June 2,2006 with five Bombardier Dash 8-400's. It did its first international flight on July 11,2008 from Jeju to Hiroshima,Japan but that is not a flight they offer as of May 2015. It began getting Boeing 737-800's in 2008 and got two that year, and as of May 2015 it now has 19 of them with nine more on order. It sold all five Dash 8-400's in June 2010 to Aires Colombia. Its routes as of May 2015 were as follows. Jeju to Seoul-Gimpo,Busan,Cheongju and Daegu which are all domestic. From Seoul-Gimpo to Osaka-Kansai and Nagoya-Centrair in Japan. And its main point of operations at Seoul-Incheon to Tokyo-Narita, Osaka-Kansai,Nagoya-Centrair,Okinawa-Naha,Fukuoka in Japan. Hong Kong. Bangkok,Thailand. Manila and Cebu Philippines. Qingdao,Yantai,Weihai,Jiamusi,and Shijiazhuang in China. Hanoi,Vietnam. And Guam and Saipan each the US territories of the Marianas Islands. It also flies between Daegu and Beijing,China.
